gpt_university_description: Warsaw University of Technology, also known as Politechnika Warszawska, is one of the top engineering universities in Poland and Central Europe. It offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various fields of engineering, technology, and applied sciences. WUT is known for its strong research output, modern facilities, and strong industry collaborations.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: Warsaw has a moderate cost of living compared to Western European cities. The average monthly expenses, including accommodation, food, transportation, and utilities, can range from 600 to 1000 USD.
gpt_location_weather: Warsaw has a humid continental climate with cold winters and mild summers. The average temperature ranges from -2°C in January to 19°C in July. Snowfall is common in winter, while summers can experience occasional thunderstorms and rainfall.
gpt_location_description: Warsaw, the capital of Poland, is a vibrant and thriving city with a rich history and diverse cultural offerings. The city features a mix of historic and modern architecture, numerous museums, parks, and a lively nightlife scene. Home to many international corporations and a growing startup ecosystem, Warsaw is an excellent place to study and work.
gpt_location_crime: The crime rate in Warsaw is comparatively low, especially regarding violent crimes. Pickpocketing and petty theft can be an issue in some touristy areas, but overall, the city is considered safe.
gpt_location_transportation: Warsaw has an extensive public transportation network, including buses, trams, and metro system. The city is well-connected and easy to navigate, making traveling within Warsaw convenient and affordable.
